pull.title: Add sighash tests from data file
pull.body: This adds SignatureHash tests derived from a data file, instead of generating random transactions like the existing test.  It allows other libraries (in my case https://github.com/bitpay/bitcore) to import the test vectors knowing they pass in Bitcoin Core. This is my first contribution (and the first C++ code I wrote), so please let me know if it needs corrections.

events.body: btw: the new test data was generated using [the existing previous test](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/test/sighash_tests.cpp#L107), by adding a few lines that printed the needed data.
Looks good to me. Would you mind including the code that was used to generate these tests (perhaps in an #if 0'ed block in sighash_tests.cpp)?

events.message: Add sighash tests from data file
Add code generating data/sighash.json test data

events.body:
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/81bfb5aebf983f999d3de12ca4adf8cd4c4a8ae0 for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.

comments.body: Perhaps catch and report deserialization errors here?
